==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|せん|ほん|k2=ぼん|yomi=o|r=y}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=せんぼん|千|tr1=sen|t1=one thousand|本|tr2=hon|pos2=counter for long slender objects}}. {{rendaku2|sort=せんぼん|hon|bon}}

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|/se.ɴ.bo.ɴ/|[sẽ̞ɴbõ̞ɴ]}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|せんぼん}}

# one thousand long slender objects

====Usage notes====
The long slender objects could be small, such as pins or pencils, or large, such as trees.

===Proper noun===
{{ja-pos|proper|せんぼん}}

# an [[avenue]] in [[Kyōto]]
# a train station and the surrounding area in [[Tatsuno]], [[Hyōgo]] [[prefecture|Prefecture]]

====Usage notes====
This is often also romanized as [[Sembon]].
